page.title: 03The Old Graveyard - Kennoway
page.content: The old{Parish Graveyard}is to be found midway up the{Causeway.}It borders the site of the old{Mercat {Square}where trade was mainly conducted in days gone by. The yard is enclosed by a high stone wall and within this wall the original parish church and its graveyard were sited. In time the church fell into a state of ruin and today no trace remains except the graveyard itself. One of the earliest remaining gravestones is that of Jean Robertson who died on Dec.9th 1702. Entry to the yard is through a heavy iron gate and on the right hand side as you enter is the{Mort House.}Here corpses were allowed to decay before burial in an effort to thwart grave robbers who sailed across the Firth of Forth from Edinburgh to obtain cadavers for the medical school.
